intro: Marlierea acuminatissima, commonly known as the sharp-pointed marlierea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated margins and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Marlierea acuminatissima is often found in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests.
